etymology.description: 中(中) (zhōng, "middle; central") + 国(國) (guó, "country; nation") = 中国(中國) (zhōngguó, "China") + 美(美) (měi, "beautiful") + 术(術) (shù, "art; technique") = 美术(美術) (měishù, "art") + 馆(館) (guǎn, "building; hall") = 美术馆(美術館) (měishùguǎn, "art museum")
etymology.interpretation: 中国(中國) (zhōngguó, "China") refers to the nation, while 美术馆(美術館) (měishùguǎn, "art museum") denotes a place dedicated to the exhibition and appreciation of art. Therefore, 中国美术馆(中國美術館) (zhōngguó měishùguǎn) describes an art museum located in China, specifically the National Art Museum of China.

examples.chinese: 我参观了中国美术馆(我參觀了中國美術館)。
examples.english: I visited the National Art Museum of China.

examples.chinese: 中国美术馆举办了新展览(中國美術館舉辦了新展覽)，吸引了众多艺术爱好者(吸引了眾多藝術愛好者)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó Měishùguǎn jǔbànle xīn zhǎnlǎn, xīyǐnle zhòngduō yìshù àihào zhě.
examples.english: The National Art Museum of China held a new exhibition, attracting numerous art enthusiasts.
